item.title: ByzantineGenerals
item.description: Original Author/link Originally described by William S. Lloyd (Lloyd1994) No web-link to independent description available. See paper (Lloyd1994) for additional details. Details Students learn of the classic Byzantine Generals problem by acting out scenarios. The Byzantine Generals problem is a classic description of the consensus problem in distributed computing, where many independent processes must agree on a “true” value for a particular measurement (especially in the case where some processes become unreliable due to faults).
